title.narrative: Land restitution and rural development -FAO - Unit for land restitution
Land restitution and rural development -FAO- Unit for land restitution

description.narrative: Detta projekt har gemensamt formulerat av Colombianska jordbruksministeriets enhet för återbördande av land (URT) och FAO. Mål: 1. Institutionellt stärkande av URT 2. Insamling och sammanställnig av bevis för att pröva fall då etniska minoriteter berövats kollektiv mark 3. Inkomstgenererande projekt för familjer som återfått jord och flyttat tillbaka till sitt område.

This project is jointly formulated by the Unit for Land Restitution (URT) and the Food and Agriculture Organisation of the UN(FAO). Objectives: 1. Strengthening of URT 2. Evidence collection for process of cases of dispossession of collective territories of ethnical minorities 3. Income generating projects for restituted families.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Up to March 31, 2017 11 collective cases (5 for indigenous and 6 for afrocolombians) have been accompanied by this project, of which 4 have finished and have entered into the dispossession registry with claims presented to the agrarian judges. These characterization processes have implied a very participative process of 14.115 people (24% indigenous and 76% afrocolombians) that have taken almost 2 years to decide property over and more than 250.000hectares of collective land. This contribution represented 40% of the total Unit’s ethnical characterization process. On the other hand, 854 projects received exclusive support by the project. The project hired technical assistance in 12 Departments and 54 municipalities contributing to 346 additional projects that were managed by the Unit. This income generating activities benefited approximately 4.270 people that could return to their land and re start sustainable life projects that in addition to subsistence, give them opportunities for stable incomes in the long term. This process has also been positive for recovering trust in public institutions and rebuilding the destroyed social fabric in those regions affected by forced displacement and land dispossession. In addition, between May 2016 and March 2017, a transition phase with a territorial approach was developed, supporting 531 people (245 restituted and 286 non restituted, 148 women and 383 men) in 6 pilots municipalities: (Tablon de Gomez-Nariño; Cienaga and Chibolo in Magdalena; Morroa-Sucre; Ataco-Tolima; Montería-Córdoba). A positive result was the implementation of environmental practices as well as training in environmental management as a key element for sustainable income generating activities. Finally, the Unit for land restitution was strengthened with better procedures for citizen's attention plan and the integrated management system. The citizen's attention plan was very well qualified by 665 women and 997 men, attended at the 18 regional offices. The integrated management system was 100% developed, including important issues such as the anticorruption strategy, the internal control system and the environmental strategy. With this support, the Unit for land restitution has processed 43.906 claims and has presented 13.785 lawsuits before the agrarian judges.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
